primary.title: University of Stirling pays tribute to Her Majesty The Queen
primary.summary: The University of Stirling is deeply saddened at the passing of Her Majesty The Queen.
primary.imagealt: Official photograph of Queen Elizabeth II

primary.title: One in four children referred to mental health services in Scotland have suicidal thoughts or behaviours, study suggests
primary.summary: A quarter of children referred to mental health services in Scotland have been thinking about or attempted suicide – and face a postcode lottery as to whether they will be assessed or treated, a new study suggests.

primary.title: Historic children’s home archive opens with donation from former resident
primary.summary: A new archive making more than a century’s worth of records from Aberlour Children’s Charity accessible for the first time has been officially opened by a former resident.
primary.imagealt: Ron Aitchison poses on campus holding a small blue booklet which is one of the items he has donated to the new archive

secondary.title: Tech project succeeds in connecting care home residents during pandemic
secondary.summary: A pioneering project introducing iPads to care homes during the pandemic had a significant impact on social isolation, according to experts at the University of Stirling.
secondary.imagealt: Healthcare worker with senior woman using digital tablet at care home

secondary.title: Most stakeholders support review of alcohol laws at UK football stadia but concerns persist, new study finds
secondary.summary: Easing legal restrictions around the sale and consumption of alcohol at UK football stadia could deliver public safety and financial benefits, but is not without risks, according to key stakeholders interviewed as part of a new University of Stirling study.

secondary.title: Classes of 2020 and 2021 return to Stirling campus to celebrate graduation
secondary.summary: More than 2,000 University of Stirling graduates who were unable to attend a ceremony in 2020 or 2021 due to the pandemic are returning to campus this week to celebrate their achievements.
secondary.imagealt: Graduates gather for the 2020/2021 celebration events.

events.title: Classes of 2020 and 2021 return to Stirling campus to celebrate graduation
events.summary: More than 2,000 University of Stirling graduates who were unable to attend a ceremony in 2020 or 2021 due to the pandemic are returning to campus this week to celebrate their achievements.
events.imagealt: Graduates gather for the 2020/2021 celebration events.
